questions.question: This UNESCO World Heritage Site in Greece is known for being the center of Mycenaean civilization and is believed to be described in Homer's epics.
questions.context: Mycenae was one of the major centers of Greek civilization, influencing the development of classical Greek culture.

questions.question: This modern architectural marvel in the United States stands as the tallest man-made structure in the Western Hemisphere.

answer.label: One World Trade Center, New York

questions.context: Completed in 2013, this tower occupies the site of the original World Trade Center destroyed in September 11 attacks.

questions.question: Located in a forested area in Belgium, this major historical battle site was the location of Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat.
questions.context: The battle in 1815 marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars, leading to Napoleon's exile.

questions.question: This museum in Russia is home to one of the largest and oldest collections of art in the world, and it was originally founded by Empress Catherine the Great.
questions.context: The museum contains over three million items and is situated near the Neva River.

questions.question: Among space exploration sites, this facility in Kazakhstan is known as the world's first and the largest operational space launch facility.
questions.context: Launched Yuri Gagarin into orbit, marking the first human journey into outer space in 1961.
